name: Mynd
description:
Established e-learning and animation company, where I solo-developed various interactive Unity-based web apps.
Some highlights include a complex 3D e-learning solution with engine-like features, or a photorealistic interactive building visualization. I had a majority contribution on these projects, spanning from designing, implementation, and testing all the way to production-scale deployment and maintenance.

name:
Masaryk University
Faculty of Informatics
description:
My ongoing master’s degree study at Masaryk University, the largest university located in the Czech Republic.
I'm enrolled in "Visual Informatics" program with a specialization in game development and advanced 3D graphics.

name: Iteria
description:
A successful startup company located in Slovakia. As a Unity developer, my primary role was developing a mobile AR application for architecture assistance and development, which was contracted by AKULAR, a software development company seated in US, Virginia.
During my time I also had the opportunity to work on projects involving more exotic devices such as HoloLens and Magic Leap. In this role, I gained valuable experience developing complex XR solutions, designing core application systems while also assisting and mentoring my colleagues.

name:
Brno University of Technology
Faculty of Information Technology
description:
Three-year bachelor's degree in the general "Information Technology" program.

Throughout my studies, I had the opportunity to delve into a diverse range of subjects spanning multiple programming languages, disciplines and fields. These include:
- OOP principles and algorithms 
- Software engineering and UI/UX design
- Numerous programming languages (C, C++, C#, Python, TeX)
- Artificial intelligence
- Networking, security and cryptography
- 3D graphics and game development
- Operating systems and x86 assembly
- HW design, microprocessors and embedded systems
- Mathematics, including algebra, calculus statistics and simulations

I achieved exceptional academic performance, consistently ranking within the top 10% percentile.
Notably, my bachelor's thesis garnered a perfect grade and received a nomination for the best thesis of the year.

name:
Cisco Certified Network Associate
(CCNA)
description:
A 2 year long certification, widely recognized as a fundamental accreditation in the networking engineering.
This certification provided me valuable knowledge in the field including:
- Switching and routing concepts
- Principles of building physical network topologies
- Configuration of enterprise-level hardware
- Insight into countless networking protocols and IP services
- Security fundamentals

name:
Secondary School of Electrical Engineering
Adlerka
description:
Popular technical high school located in Bratislava, the main city of Slovakia.
The focus of my studies was on Information and Network Technology.
Throughout my time at the school, I actively promoted it through various game projects I developed.
